content.detailedDescription:
I was about 9 or 10 in 1974.  it was night time in dallas, tx.  about 9:00 pm. summertime. me and my brother and sister were playing in the park while my dad and uncle played tennis.  i went off alone and i saw in the sky, an object that appeared to be flying or moving very slowly going at an angle down.  

the object was white.  like a bright light. one round 2 dimensional bright white ball on side and the same on the other.  and in between them about as far apart of about two house-lengths was a bright light bar holding the balls together. the balls were like the size of a house.  i was at a park. i didn't know what to do, or who to tell.  i was scared of ufo's ever since. then i heard about mufon on the discovery channel.  but i do know that i never, ever have heard or seen anyone describe this thing.  it was really flat looking, very bright, quiet, and looked like it was going to land, but it disappeared. i tried to get my dad to look, but he was busy playing tennis.  has anyone ever described something like this?
content.summary: Two dimension object.  two round objects on either side of a long pole. horizontal.

content.detailedDescription:
1 in my driveway getting ready to get in the car
2 the bright lights, it was dark outside
3 plane
4 it was stationary over the trees and then sped away
5 scared, stopped looking and backed out of driveway and drove to work, looked straight ahead and did not look back
6 stopped looking
content.summary: Was in front of me over the trees, then sped over the neighbors house

content.detailedDescription:
We (my wife and i) were outside when a commercial jet flying overhead drew our attention.  we noticed another object in the vicinity, but lower and slower than the airliner.  the airliner had left our field of view by this time.   object was cylindrical, blunt on both ends and what caught our eye was that it had no wings or fins.  it was white with a large red stripe around its' midsection.  again, no sound.  by the time i went inside and got my camera, this pic was all i could get.  it appeared "floating" mmore than under power, and we watched until we couldn't see it anymore.

we were somewhat puzzled and skeptical about the odd shape, no wings and no noise.

date stamp on photo is correct, but the time appears to be incorrect as it was bright and sunny.
content.summary: Commercial jet overhead drew our attention, saw cylinder nearby

content.detailedDescription: At 11:10 am while making sales calls, i was stopped at the intersection of gate parkway and j turner butler blvd facing east.  while stopped and looking up at about a 45 degree angle though my windshield i noticed a flashing object at a very high altitude.  there were no contrails associated with the flash.  the flash was similar to a reflection of light from a mirrored object.  it only lasted 4-5 seconds and there was no sign of any other activity as i continued to scan the sky.  i am an aircraft enthusiast and quite frequently look to the skies for navy aircraft that train in our area.
content.summary: Flash at high altitude with no contrails

content.detailedDescription:
Amnesic(slightly),
   hiked from canada's border to san diego, some missing time, will report back later. jdi/oa for halloween.
kristoffer alex cannon- cp rjp
content.summary: Missing time in washington state

content.detailedDescription: My husband & i were driving west toward bee caves rd. on ben white blvd. in 1975 on a sunday.  the road was under construction and there was a dead end.(the barton creek mall area ) a man driving a white ford falcon had pulled over to the side of the road. we thought something was wrong with the car since he had not turned around due to the dead end road.  we pulled over directly in back of him and saw him looking towards the south west.  we immediately look up and saw a ufo hovering so close to us.  it looked to be almost in reach.  we rolled the car windows down to get a better view.  it sit there for a few seconds longer.  my husband opened the car door to get out and that is when it took off in such a high speed.  if you blinked you would miss it.  that is how fast it actully went up.  we went back to my parents house and told them.  my father absolutly forbid me to call the bergstrom afb.  i will never forget that day.  i still close my eyes at night and see it after all those years.  after you see what we did, you will never feel the same.  it is almost like you have a secret that you can't tell anyone because they will not believe you.  my husband was working on his ph.D. at ut at the time.  i wanted him to report it to the proper department there but he would not.
content.summary: Milky - white in color

content.detailedDescription:
My son and i playing softball in our backyard noticed several star-like orbs coming out of the eastern sky from the columbia river gorge during a beautifully "clear" blue sky!!! at approx 3pm!!!  each orb travelled its own path as if they were preditory military placements in the sky... a few took lower altitude positions others took random high altitude positions as much as i could guess being 35-45,000 feet. each became stationery as they floated gracefully into a "sound" position as if they stood a battlefront!!!  my son pointed out a 7th after we had counted together 6 orbs!!!

one of the orbs as within a near-path of a commercial airliner flying toward seattle from the south and the orb was undisturbed by the turbulence of the large aircraft!!! as it held its position in the commercial plane's wake!

we pointed out to our neighbors and one neighbor across the street who was an older viet resident looked and looked and then said "oh!!! you guys have great eyes to see them!!!  yeah!<< i see them!!"

the orbs hovered for about 5 minutes then it seemed they faded into the outer atmosphere!!!  they were brighter than the sun with a beautiful pure white light to them!!! as well nearly blinding if you looked too long!

i told my son that we will go inside to see the tv because i felt there was something very strange about this event in broad daylight!!! 

sure enough!!!! on the tv was a news report of 2 f-15 fighters downed in the eastern columbia river gorge near the bio/chem/radiation munitions bunkers and soon to be incinerator!!!  i forgot the name of the site!

on the tv there were instant broadcasts of hundreds of witnesses of 2 fighters in "chase" as they elevated into the blue sky then they said they saw flashes of light.. . 

soon they also said on the news report that 2 fighters were downed in the columbia river.  one of the 4 crewmembers survived being dragged from the river stating that "they were struck from behind and there was nothing they could do about it!!!   they came from nowhere!!!"

i knew then that our sightings of the orbs were significant to the downing of our own fighters!!!  


john michael
content.summary: 7 star-like orbs in random patterns leaving columbia riv. after 2 f-15's downed

content.detailedDescription:
This event took place on 10/27/2008 at 2 am; there were 4 of us sitting around a burn barrel doing some strike duty. the night was clear not a cloud in the sky with the stars very visible in the sky, when all of a sudden this oval shaped bright white craft with a haze around it  appeared out of no where, shot at about a 45 degree angle towards the ground and then  just disappeared the speed was very fast. if i was to guess at the speed it had to have been well over 200 mph the event lasted only a couple of seconds. 
this in no way was a shooting star i saw one earlier that night, it was not an airplane nor any kind of other light source like a search light , i  have never witnessed anything like this nor my buddies we were talking about this for the next couple of hours.
content.summary: Bright white oval light with a haze around it

content.detailedDescription:
On the night of october 23rd. my wife was closing a window in our master bedroom when she observed a strange cluster of lights in the distance. she called me over to take a look at it, and at first i thought it might be a helicopter, since is was at a lower level then a domestic aircraft would have been at night. it was level with our backyard treetops but many miles out. the more i observed this, the pattern of the lights was unlike any i have ever observed before. 

we live fairly close to austin bergstrom international airport and camp swift and observe a fairly steady amount of  air traffic usually heading in the direction of abia coming in from the east. so, we have seen domestic and military aircraft in flight at night many times before.

i myself am an ex paratrooper, and have had extensive experience with military aircraft at night and these lights where unlike any aircraft night lights i have ever seen.

as i said i thought it might be a helicopter at first but it made no noise that i could discern and seemed to be hovering at much higher ceiling then a helicopter would, along with the wacky lightshow. i thought that perhaps it could be a star, it was about as clear that night as the night sky could be, but the lights coming off it were unlike any starlight reflection and it was much lower on the horizon then the stars  in that direction. 

with the naked eye we could make out red and white colors flashing with a strobbing effect off it. 

i retrieved a pair of binoculars, 7 x 50 mm with a zoom lens, and could clearly see not only the red and white lights but blue, red, white and greens.  the lights were flashing with a very fast strobbing effect. different colors in a cluster strobbing very fast without any real pattern. i could not make out a shape of the craft of any sort with the binoculars, since it was too far out of range for the binoculars, i could just make out the cluster of lights.  

i observed this ufo for 30 minutes with the binoculars, and for the most part it would be fixed in same part of the sky with slight deviations up, down, right and left. 

after 30 minutes observing it with the binoculars waiting for it to do something like take off or disappear, i went to bed. i told my wife that if that isn't a ufo then the only thing i could think of that it might be would be a star. she stayed up for awhile longer i and told her that if it was still there by the time she went to bed that it might be a star, however if it was gone in the next 30 minutes chances are it was ufo. she came in 30 minutes later to tell me it was no longer visible. 

the reason i felt it necessary to report it, is because our sighting corresponds to another sighting in stephenville texas on the same night and, the direction of our sighting would have placed it in that general location northeast of austin texas.
content.summary: Odd cluster of lights.

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside sunday morning between 5:20 to 5:45 (no later) in my backyard and i was viewing the western/northwestern sky looking for meteors and i saw a bright, white flash suddenly come into view in the west and it started to move west/nw. it dimmed very quickly and disappeared altogether. i continued to view the skies thinking i just saw a satellite, but to my utmost amazement, i saw a very bright white flash to the right of my viewing, and it too started to dim and move due north and disappeared in a manner of seconds. i would to add that there was no sound, no 'after sound' of an airlplane.

i would like to add, that i am a light sleeper and i have been going outside to views stars in the early morning for quite a few years now and i know what airplanes, satellites and the space station look like when they are passing by. 

this flash was brighter than vega or venus and the initial viewing was too the right of perseas constellation about 10 degrees. the second observation was to the left of the big dipper about 80 degrees. (if you showed me a constellation map of the sky right now, i would be able to pinpoint both sightings).

as i said, this was too odd to be taken at face value, i do not know of anything that can burst into such brightness then dim, move and disappear in about 15 to 20 seconds, and to happen twice within about 2 minutes. it was too weird!
content.summary: Bright white light bursted into view, then dimmed then went north, disappeared after 10 sconds.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife, daughter, and i were driving home from reno, nv near uc davis on highway 80 and saw what we thought was a falling star.  it fell a very long time, with a very bright long trail behind it.  it was falling stright down.  then, it suddenly stopped, and started shinning bright like a star.  after about 10 seconds, it started zig-zagging down towards the ground with trails, until it disappeared behind some trees.

it was definitely not a falling star.  we don't know what it was though.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: I would've swore this was a falling star but, it stopped dead in it's trail and sat hoovering for a few seconds, shinning brightly, as it started to zig-zap down to the ground.

content.detailedDescription: V shaped lights moving north to south, west of arcadia,fl object had to be very large.Lost object behind trees after 45 sec.1min after fast moving aircraft came from northwest flew over and past sighting area and returned back direction it came from.  standing on carport smoking
content.summary: Appr 8 dim v shaped lights

content.detailedDescription:
I was on the north side of indianapolis driving west on 86th street.  at college avenue,  i saw 4 orange fiery lights in the sky. the lights were headed north/north east.

i turned north on college to follow the lights which were hard to track because of trees.  i turned east on 91st street and pulled into an apartment complex to get out of the car and watch them as i called a friend to come to meet me. 

the sky was dark.  the ufo���s appeared as orange fireballs and moved in complete silence.  the four fireballs were headed north/northeast toward u.S. 31.  (we were about 80 miles south of grissom a.F.B.).   

as soon as the four u.Fo.���s were out of sight, i looked back and saw four more come from the same direction.  they were not flying in formation, but all proceeded north/northeast.  

a friend caught up with me in time to see the last u.F.O. which is he said hovered and lowered and then took off fast enough to disappear before his eyes. i didn���t see the last u.F.O. because a tree was blocking my view. 

i wonder if they were experimental military craft/weaponry.
content.summary: 8 ufo's appear as orange fireballs flying north/northeast from 91st and college avenue, indianapolis

http://uk.Jokkmokk.Jp/
content.summary: White sphere over porjus sweden

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting in a friends back yard around a little fire pit fire with about 8 friends. we were just sitting around talking and having a good time. a few friends had started seeing falling stars. so i was keeping a eye on the skies in the hope of seeing a falling star myself. my friends backyard that we were at is kinda on the outskirts of town but still in the city limits. lafayette louisiana is were i was. their airport in very close to town and it is a normal thing to see little planes and large planes coming and going. i work at night and see planes all the time. and because the airport is very close to the city, planes are low flying all around. just saying that to let you know, that i know what i did see was not a plane. but i was sitting to where i was facing towards town and i had seen a couple looked like 20 or so passanger planes heading up and out of town. and i could see the lights of the city illuminating the sky. i happened to look up at one point and see a cluster of tiny white lights shaped like a triangle without the bottom line to close it. > like that. or like a flock of birds. none of the lights blinked. they all stayed pure white. along the outter all the lights where straight and defined the triangle shape. but there were some set out from the outter lights. i watched it for a few seconds then started asking others to looks and see if they could see it. asking if i was just seeing things or if they saw it too. i literally pulled a friend down buy me to try and make her see it. but with all the powerlines and few trees no one could see it. it kept moving on a straight path until it did finally dissapear behind some trees. i started asking friends there if they knew if birds could reflect light. because it really is the best way to describe the lights formation. it was like a flock of pure white glowing flock of birds. no one including me didn't hear any noise. my girlfriend immediatly asked me if it was just a plane. i said of course not. we would have heard jet noise and the lights i saw looked to be higher up than the planes are coming and going from our airport. i have researched in vain since seeing the lights. trying to find out if birds really can relect light or if there have been ufo's sighted that look like the one i saw. and honestly the ufo's that were sited over lubbock texas back in the 50's seem to be the closets i can find of a ufo documented that i have found that looked like the one i saw. except the one i saw the lights were bunched closer together. the the outter line of the > then a couple rows of lights out from the outter lines. i hope i have conveyed good enough what i saw. it has really thrown me for a loop. i feel so odd seeing something unexplainable. i want to know i'm not crazy and others have seen what i did or there is an explenation for what i saw. but i am not believing that just birds reflecting light is what i saw!
content.summary: Cluster of white lights shaped like >

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i were driving to western north carolina for a weekend get-away. and as we were driving south on highway 81 near the border of virgina and tennessee we both saw a stationary shadowy disc or triangle wobbling in and out of the wispy cloud cover a little off of the horizon.  we both made comments about the strangeness of the object and then i (she was driving) pulled out my camera and shot the photo that is attached.  as we drive the angle did not allow us to see it anymore.  total time of viewing was about 4-6 seconds.
content.summary: Disc or triangle wobbling in and out of cloads

content.detailedDescription: I was alone on my way home from chesapeake to portsmouth va, friday oct 24, about 9:30 pm. i was driving my usual route on the edge of the dismal swamp. my favorite route, old mill rd, is a lonely dark curvy road, with no traffic lights. the sky was a beautiful dark blue. i think the moon was full. the sky was patched with large fluffy white clouds. it's close to deer mating season, and deer run across the road, so my eyes were closely following on the road. above a clump of cyprus and oak trees, i noticed what i thought was an oddly moving jet airliner. i say odd because it moved much slower than a helicopter and emitted no sound. it was also to low to be an airliner. it wasn't a blimp either. the aircraft displayed about 7 large lights on each side of the chevron or triangular shaped craft with a green light on my left as i looked up. as i stated before, the sky was bright, but it was night.I was not afraid, but curious. the craft soon flew over trees that obscured my view. the last time i saw something strange like this i was around 12, 1973. my brother told me to wait while he went in the house to get daddy. heck, no! i went with him, when daddy came out it was gone. it was shaped like a shallow bowl on top of a saucer. the aircraft had many windows and lights all around and red lights on top. we saw this aircraft two more times the summer 1974 with my eldest brother and a neighborhood kid. i live 20 miles from norfolk naval, oceana air naval and langley air force base. i have lived within the proximity of naval and air force bases all around me all my life. i have seen plenty of planes, jets, helicopters, stealth fighters and jets that take off straight up from a aircraft carrier, but i have never seen something like this and what we saw when i was 12.
content.summary: Ufo over dismal swamp va

content.detailedDescription:
First off, this event happened to me many years ago when i was just a little kid living in vidor, tx. i now live in orange, tx. i know that this story will probably not do you guys any good, but i feel like i need to finally tell it. up to this point, i have only told my fiancee of this event.


it was a nice summer night and the skies were clear. i use to live in a house that my parents built with a nice 5 to 7 acre lake behind it, secluded from town. i was six years old at the time, i am now currently 19, soon to be 20. i remember exactly what happened on that night. my parents were inside the house along with my older brother. i was in the backyard playing fetch with my black lab, named tucker. growing up, tucker was my best friend. i remember throwing the ball and racing tucker to see who could get to it first. of course he did, so we started wrestling for it. at that time he stopping playing and let out a soft whimper. i thought i had acciently hurt him. as i was asking him if he was okay, i noticed that he was looking up into the night sky. i then turned my head and looked up and saw the aircraft that i knew, even at that age, was not an airplane or jet. from where i was there were 8 orange lights, apart from each other, making a circular chape. in the middle was one large orange circular light. thinking back on it, the large light was the size of a football field, and the smaller one's were 50 yards wide. all of the light would be bright for a second, then the next second, they would be dim. it was stationary just for a brief moment, then all of the sudden it started zooming through the air with no sound at all. it traveled one direction for about 2 or 3 seconds, then disappeared. i was so scared that i grabbed tucker's collar and ran inside to my room. after that, i was scared for months. so scared that a part of my hair turned grey from the amount of stress the fear was putting on me, and i still have the greys in my hair to this day. as i am writing this, i am feeling the fear that i had forgotten. when i see the gray patch in my hair, i sometimes think back to what i saw that night. at that age, i knew what aliens and ufo's were, but like magic, i thought it was just make-believe. but on that night, i knew what i had saw. ever since that night, i have always shown a keen interest about the truth that is out there. i know what i saw, but was afraid of what others may think, so i kept it to myself until i was 15. i told my girlfriend, who is currently my fiancee about my encounter. but now, with all of the ufo sightings out there, i don't think people will be too quick to judge me now. this is the first time i am telling this story to the public.
content.summary: 8 small orange lights in a circular shape with 1 large orange light in center

content.detailedDescription:
I live on the western limits of nashville proper. friday, october 24th 2008,shortly after dark as i was sitting on my balcony i began to see strange lights strobe in the western sky. the strobe was not continuous, but just a single flash of light here and there, much like a camera flash. i became very curious and decided to sky watch that night till after midnight. i saw a half dozen events that night where a single white light appeared at high altitude, then slowly traversed a hands-width distance (est.) before fading out. 

the next night(saturday, oct. 25th) i decided to sky watch again, being intrigued by these events. shortly after dark i began to see the same events unfold again. only this time, the strobe flashes was pretty much all i saw till a few minutes after eleven. at that time, i was looking to the western sky along the i-40 corridor when suddenly a luminous object was descending about a half mile from me. initially, i can only describe it as a vertically destorted glow worm. the object was silent, and appeared to be veiled in a thin cloud of vapor as it moved. i called out to my wife to come and look. as she stepped out it was maybe 100 yards from us, and at an elevation of maybe 400 feet. at that point the object had leveled horizontally into a cresent shape and was moving easterly into the belleview community at 20-25 mph. within a minute the object had moved silently out of sight. the object appearance was a soft luminous glow. the sky was clear, the temperature was upper 40's, there was no wind at all this night, and we both witnessed this reality that defies our logic, and has challenged every sense of reasoning.
content.summary: 125' -150' long - crescent shaped string of (25 to 30) 6' luminous irregular shaped spheres.

content.detailedDescription:
At 22:20 on october 26, 2008 three(3) objects spotted in upper stratosphere directly east of princeton, texas in collin county. 
the three objects rotated counter clockwise first flashing all at the same time(independent event lasting 10 minutes), as rotation slowed and spread the three individual object flashed independantly of each other. (independent event lasting 5 minutes). after spreading apart the point pointing east flashed very brightly and moved to form single line with the other 2 flashing points (independent event lasting 5 minutes). after this episode the 2 flashing end points moved to complete another triangular formation (one moving west the other moving south, event lasting another 5 minutes) all objects continued random bright flashing . object then ceased flashing  but shone a continuous light the objects then  spun very quickly(counter clockwise) and coming together with a very bright flash and the disappeared.  total occurrence lasted approximately thirty(30) minutes. the color of the flashes ranged from deep red to bright white.

during this episode my two dogs acted very peculiarly whining and crying and rubbing their head upon the ground(as if they could hear something i could not). i was unable to look away as this events were taking place. knowing only what the dogs were doing by what i heard.
content.summary: At 22:20 on october 26, 2008 three(3) objects spotted in upper stratosphere directly east of princeton, texas in collin county.

content.detailedDescription: I am a police field sergeant, while working on friday 10/24/08 at about 10:20pm i was parked in a parking lot in the downtown indpls. area since it was a slow night. over the downtown horizon and in what appeared the be the northeast quadrant of marion county (indianapolis), at what appeared to be about 10 miles away from my location, i observed about 10-15 circular, amber/orange lights, floating or flying upwards and into the wind. i could not tell if these objects were leaving the ground or just rising from a lower altitude because of my view being obstructed from the buildings downtown and the horizon in general. initially i saw 3 of these objects rising, they looked like they were equally spaced apart, but at different altitudes. i dont believe it was one unit, but rather 3 seperate objects. about 20 seconds or so after the first 3, i observed 3-4 more of these objects ascending in the same manner as the first 3. then shortly after, i observe about 6-8 more of the same type objects following the same path. i dont believe they were hot air or helium balloons because i wouldnt think they would fly into the wind, however i am no expert and they may be capable of just this. it was a somewhat rainy and cloudly night, however not raining at the time, but after they objects got so high i could no longer observe them. i am not sure if this was due to the clouds blocking my view, the lights going or buring out or some other reason. i did not see any mention of this on the local news. i also seen what appeared to be a commerical aircraft heading towards the objects path. the aircraft and wind was going from west to east, and the amber lighted objects were going from east to west at a somewhat gradual pace or variance. the objects cleared the aircrafts path about 20-30 seconds prior to the aircraft arriving in the area. i assume the aircraft had just left the indianapolis international airport, located on the westside of indianapolis. i also sent an email to the indianapolis star to inquire as to whether any one else has reported these objects or if there might have been a legitimate reason for their presence, but so far i have not heard back. i attempted to take cellphone camera picture and video but you cant see the objects due to poor camera quality in cellphones. again maybe these were balloons or something else not unusual, but i have seen this before. i also want to mention that several hours later i did see what is mistakenly called a "shooting star" in the same direction as the objects. this was unusual to me because of my earlier sighting as well as the fact that this one appeared to be brighter and close to the ground than any previous shooting star i have seen before. i know they really arent stars, but rather meteorite pieces or somthing like that. but the shooting star could just be a coincidence. thank you in advance for your time and consideration in this matter. hopefully it gets figured out and its some simple explanation.
content.summary: I observed 10-15 amber/orange colored lights floating or flying upwards and into the wind.

content.detailedDescription:
Man, i found this one really really really strange.  amazing what detail you can extract using astronomy software (iris) and gimp, a free photoshop-type clone.

please click on video for an exact rendition of events.  pictures attached of what could be aliens...
content.summary: Looks like a boat in the sky, possible aliens in flying boat

content.detailedDescription:
It was in the late 1950s when i was around 7 years old. my brother and i were lying on the front steps at our grandparents farmhouse watching the sky. he was around 14 years old. i was too young to work hard on the farm but he spent the day working in the tobacco field and was tired. he fell asleep as i was still looking at the billions of stars above that night. looking eastward, the horizon was lit with a thin line of light shining from the town of wilson. it was around 10pm. suddenly a glow rose above the horizon and proceeded to come toward the farm. i quickly noticed that the glow was 3 balls of fire moving at a high rate of speed at about a thousand feet above the ground. there was no noise coming from them. the ball in the middle was twice as large at the two others on each side of the middle one. in a moment of maybe 6 to 10 seconds it moved from the horizon and went straight overhead and into the opposite horizon. i was so excited that i tried to scream to my brother but nothing would come out. i shook him awake and gained my voice and told him of the incident. for several minutes we watched hoping it would come around again. we had thought that maybe it was going around the world! after maybe 15-20 minutes he fell asleep again and i continued watching the sky. as god is my witness it happened again! and again i was too excited to voice myself right away. all i could do was shake my brother and tell him again. i really don't quite remember what happened after that except that we eventually went to bed. the fireballs never came back again. 

the reason that i'm reporting this now is that awhile back i was watching a ufo show on tv and one of the reports was of three fireballs going over russia in the late 1950s! i can't help but think that i saw those very same fireballs on my side of the earth. so i'm writing to try to find some possible confirmation about this. could you tell me if you have any reports of something of this type around this timeframe?

thank you,

phillip batchelor
content.summary: 3 fireballs moving across night sky
